summary.body: Although there have been a few posts on bike parking, I thought that - before approaching the Estates Office - it would be helpful to see whether there is support for better ( ) facilities to lock up bikes in the car parks. Although the bike park coffins are available, at 70 p/a these are fairly pricey ... Would anybody else support me in asking for just some basic racks that took up a couple of (empty) car park spaces that we could actually lock bikes to? This would cost virtually nothing.  Surely the Corporation could do this to enhance its green credentials?
summary.subject: Support for basic bike rack in car park?

summary.body: Yesterday, I have learned that the we can have the plants of the flowerbeds for free , only ask the gardeners.  I would like to exhort the BEO  a) to create a system to recycle at least the geraniums that overwinter in the Barbican without no problems and to offer the plants that otherwise will be thrown away to the residents in order to make the Barbican a greener place. b) use the a. m. geraniums to embellish Frobisher Crescent that looks complete concrete to me. Love Strawby
summary.subject: Plants of flower beds

summary.body: why are their two different lighting systems on the estate.  a nice white and a sordid orange on the podium area.  could we standardise on the white and get all of the white lights that are installed around the perimeter on the walls made to work.
summary.subject: lights on the estate

summary.body: just wanted to update people ... a little while ago there was a discussion on whether a communtiy composting scheme was viable in the new wildlife garden to take all the old plants that are ripped out from planters, terraces etc ...  i pursued and very helpful officers from the council responded ... but alas no compost heap will be forthcoming ... vermin threat too close to residential properties ...  so its back to the wormery on the balcony ...
summary.subject: community composting
